intro: Pseudopentatropis oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pseudopentatropis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
